banner.title: TP WorkLife 10/12
banner.mainContentHeadline: The podcast where science meets business
banner.mainContent: From fixing meetings to finding a mentor, get new insights to help you enjoy your time at work and thrive in your career.

videoData.title: Reinventing creative thinking

nodes.whoTheyAre: Luc de Brabandere is a fellow and Senior Advisor with BCG, specializing in applying creativity and strategic vision techniques to business. He is a professor at the Louvain School of Management and the Ecole Centrale in Paris. He is the author or co-author of a dozen books including "The Forgotten Half of Change" and "Thinking in New Boxes."

videoData.description: Thinking out of the box -- it's one of the most cited strategies for innovation. Corporate philosopher Luc de Brabandere pondered exactly what was happening in our minds when we think creatively, and shares his own perspective on this strategy. He argues that the most incredible ideas don't come from just thinking beyond the perimeter of our current perception, but from relocating our minds to an entirely different box where preconceived ideas don't limit imagination.
